Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

Tracking them down in New Mexico, Chad and saloon owner Nate (Warren Stevens) chase after gang leader Drago (Morgan Woodward), who has taken Chad's ex-lover Uvalde (Joan Staley) as a hostage.

This riles local brothel madam Erica Page (Allison Hayes), so she employs Cane Miro (John Ireland), a hired gun with an axe to grind, to bring an end to Hood and her brand of justice. When Miro meets Hood, though, he is struck by her strength and beauty. Still, the passion that begins to burn between them will not prevent their inevitable showdown.

programme.title: The Tall Men
programme.desc: Ben and Clint Allison have been hired to lead a herd of cattle from Texas to Montana. Before long, they see a tribe of Native Americans raiding a small pioneer village. The brothers save the spirited Nella Turner and romantic sparks immediately fly between Nella and Ben. However, Nella's desire for wealth puts a damper on their burgeoning relationship. Meanwhile, the cattle drivers must make one last trip through unwelcoming native territories.

programme.desc: Gunman Martin Brady (Robert Mitchum) is an American exiled in Mexico for the revenge killing of his father's assassin. Brady, a henchman of the ruthless Castro crime family, travels across the border to Texas to negotiate the sale of black market rifles. programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Ben Cartwright is the patriarch of an all-male Nevada ranching family. Set during and after the Civil War, "Bonanza" is the story of life on the family's thousand-acre spread, known as the Ponderosa, near Virginia City. Ben has his three sons, each with a different (and deceased) mother. Serious eldest son Adam hopes to follow in his father's footsteps; middle son Hoss is a gentle giant -- physically strong, but sometimes naive; and youngest son Little Joe is the most impetuous and romantic of the offspring.

programme.title: Annie Oakley

programme.desc: Gilad Janklowicz combines several types of exercise into one workout routine, including strength and circuit training, cardio, kickboxing, and martial arts. programme.title: Wounded Warrior Project featuring Trace Adkins
Holiday
programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

programme.title: Top Secret Affair
programme.desc: A publisher (Susan Hayward) uses her magazine and charm to derail a general (Kirk Douglas) on the Washington fast track.

programme.title: The Gun That Won the West
programme.desc: Superior Springfield rifles help scouts (Dennis Morgan, Richard Denning) and the cavalry get forts built in Wyoming.

programme.title: The Law West of Tombstone
programme.desc: A young gunslinger falls in love with the daughter of a judge who dispenses justice from a frontier saloon.

programme.title: Massacre River
programme.desc: Two Army officers (Guy Madison, Rory Calhoun) love the colonel's daughter and face Indians.

programme.title: Coroner Creek
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Randolph Scott) loses his beloved in a robbery and hunts the man (George Macready) to blame, who is living off the loot.

programme.title: Back Street
programme.desc: Fannie Hurst's best seller of a married man and his mistress who foster a passionate affair for over 20 years.

programme.title: The Valley of Decision
programme.desc: An Irish maid, Mary Rafferty (Greer Garson), falls for Paul (Gregory Peck), who is the son of her rich boss, William Scott (Donald Crisp). To further complicate matters, Mary's father, Pat (Lionel Barrymore), lost both of his legs in an accident at the steel mill owned by Paul's father. Neither William nor Pat approves of the couple's romance, and the burgeoning relationship only becomes a bigger battleground when a strike erupts at the steel mill.

programme.title: Wyoming Renegades
programme.desc: An ex-convict (Phil Carey) and his girlfriend (Martha Hyer) cannot start over until they stop Butch Cassidy's (Gene Evans) gang.

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon
programme.desc: Sherlock Holmes (Basil Rathbone) saves noted Swiss physicist Franz Tobel (William Post Jr.) from the Gestapo in Zurich and smuggles him to London. There, Tobel is reunited with his wife, Charlotte (Kaaren Verne), to whom he gives a coded message in the event he disappears. Tobel presents the weapon he developed to government officials, and when he is subsequently abducted by arch-villain Professor Moriarty (Lionel Atwill), Holmes and Dr. Watson (Nigel Bruce) risk their lives to find him.

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A bloodstain provides Holmes with a clue in the theft of a vital government document.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: When a preacher comes to Dodge City to condemn gambling as sinful and disrupts activities in Ganly's saloon, he eventually finds himself drawn into a poker game against Ganly.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid Returns
programme.desc: Pancho and the Kid attempt to prove that they did not kidnap the child they are protecting from a killer.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick, an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible; his simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: Paid Programming: Carshield -- Cars Have Changed
The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Earp and Doc Holliday prevent the men of the Bar-W ranch from lynching suspected horse thief Joe Riva; while Earp investigates the true culprit, Doc plans a scheme with Joe's daughter to take the blame off him.

programme.title: Back Street
programme.desc: Fannie Hurst's best seller of a married man and his mistress who foster a passionate affair for over 20 years.

programme.title: The Valley of Decision
programme.desc: An Irish maid, Mary Rafferty (Greer Garson), falls for Paul (Gregory Peck), who is the son of her rich boss, William Scott (Donald Crisp). To further complicate matters, Mary's father, Pat (Lionel Barrymore), lost both of his legs in an accident at the steel mill owned by Paul's father. Neither William nor Pat approves of the couple's romance, and the burgeoning relationship only becomes a bigger battleground when a strike erupts at the steel mill.

programme.title: Snake River Desperadoes
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) squares off against men who are trying to ignite a war between whites and American Indians.

programme.title: Wyoming Renegades
programme.desc: An ex-convict (Phil Carey) and his girlfriend (Martha Hyer) cannot start over until they stop Butch Cassidy's (Gene Evans) gang.

programme.title: Coroner Creek
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Randolph Scott) loses his beloved in a robbery and hunts the man (George Macready) to blame, who is living off the loot.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: Jet Pilot
programme.desc: During the Cold War, a Russian jet enters airspace over Alaska and is escorted to an American air base. The pilot, Anna Marladovna (Janet Leigh) demands asylum but refuses to provide information on Soviet activities. Col. Jim Shannon (John Wayne) receives orders to befriend Anna in order to win her confidence and gather information. The pilots compete with each other but gradually fall in love. When it appears Anna may be deported, Jim marries her -- only to discover that she may be a spy.

programme.title: Madame X
programme.desc: Holly Parker (Lana Turner) is married to high-powered diplomat Clay Anderson (John Forsythe), but finds that her attention wanders when he's away. She starts an affair with a wealthy bachelor (Ricardo Montalban), but her life unravels when he dies unexpectedly. Her mother-in-law (Constance Bennett) advises Holly to leave Clay and their baby and start a new life. Years later, when a petty criminal (Burgess Meredith) tries to blackmail Holly, who is now a prostitute, things get even worse for her.

programme.title: Stolen Face
programme.desc: A plastic surgeon (Paul Henreid) makes a convict look like the pianist (Lizabeth Scott) he loves, then marries her.

programme.title: The Racketeer
programme.desc: New York City gangster Mahlon Keene (Robert Armstrong) melts when he meets down-on-her-luck beauty Rhoda (Carole Lombard), a society gal who's in desperate need of dough to support herself and her boyfriend, Tony (Roland Drew), a brilliant violinist with a serious drinking problem. Mahlon pulls some strings to help Tony get back on top; in return, Rhoda is to dump the musician and marry the mobster. The already heated situation is further complicated when the cops decide to crack down on Mahlon.

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes connects a school chum's family ritual with a butler's disappearance.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Rumors of large buffalo herds prompt Bat and a number of hunters to ride out in search of pelts; Earp learns about a roaming tribe of Apache hunters and heads out to warn Bat, but hostilities quickly break out between the groups.

programme.title: Lawless Range
programme.desc: Rodeo man John Middleton (John Wayne) is called upon for a favor by Hank Mason (Wally Howe), a friend of the Middletons who lives in a nearby town. But, when John arrives at Hank's, the man's niece, Ann (Sheila Mannors), informs him that Hank has been abducted. John then teams up with the local sheriff, takes on a disguise and begins investigating cattle rustlers who could be connected to the disappearance. He's led to a corrupt banker (Frank McGlynn Jr.), who has plans to take over the town.

programme.title: The Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Washed-up film director Harry Dawes (Humphrey Bogart) gets a second chance at stardom when he discovers stunning peasant Maria Vargas (Ava Gardner) dancing in a nightclub in Madrid, Spain. Goaded by his producer, strong-arming Wall Street financier Kirk Edwards (Warren Stevens), Harry convinces her to screen test for, and then star in, his next big picture. But as Edwards' possessive nature and the realities of stardom weigh on Maria, she seeks a genuine lover with whom she can escape.

programme.title: Snake River Desperadoes
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) squares off against men who are trying to ignite a war between whites and American Indians.

programme.title: Taming of the West
programme.desc: A new lawman (Bill Elliott) punches out cattle rustlers who like to shoot sheriffs.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: The conniving Ed Barker (Dick Curtis) murders a rancher and tries to steal the ranch from his widow, Jean Andrews (Ann Doran). However, their old friend Cliff Houston (Charles Starrett) appears on the scene to try and save the day. He makes a deal with Barker and his crew to drive the Andrews herd to market and split the money, but each man really plans to con the other as soon as the time is right. Along for the ride is singing cowboy Bob Stevens (Bob Nolan).

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: Dodge City
programme.desc: In 1872, Dodge City, Kansas is the epicenter of cattle drives and lawlessness. Run by Jeff Surrett (Bruce Cabot), Dodge City isn't safe for anyone or anything. When Wade Hatton (Errol Flynn) arrives for a cattle drive, he's moved by the violent death of a young boy to take up the post of sheriff and take back the town from Surrett and his cohorts. But first he must contend with the rowdy townsfolk who, having been so long without law, desire to take the law into their own hands.

programme.title: Jet Pilot
programme.desc: During the Cold War, a Russian jet enters airspace over Alaska and is escorted to an American air base. The pilot, Anna Marladovna (Janet Leigh) demands asylum but refuses to provide information on Soviet activities. Col. Jim Shannon (John Wayne) receives orders to befriend Anna in order to win her confidence and gather information. The pilots compete with each other but gradually fall in love. When it appears Anna may be deported, Jim marries her -- only to discover that she may be a spy.

programme.title: The Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Washed-up film director Harry Dawes (Humphrey Bogart) gets a second chance at stardom when he discovers stunning peasant Maria Vargas (Ava Gardner) dancing in a nightclub in Madrid, Spain. Goaded by his producer, strong-arming Wall Street financier Kirk Edwards (Warren Stevens), Harry convinces her to screen test for, and then star in, his next big picture. But as Edwards' possessive nature and the realities of stardom weigh on Maria, she seeks a genuine lover with whom she can escape.

programme.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
programme.desc: Questions arise when Senator Stoddard (James Stewart) attends the funeral of a local man named Tom Doniphon (John Wayne) in a small Western town. Flashing back, we learn Doniphon saved Stoddard, then a lawyer, when he was roughed up by a crew of outlaws terrorizing the town, led by Liberty Valance (Lee Marvin). As the territory's safety hung in the balance, Doniphon and Stoddard, two of the only people standing up to him, proved to be very important, but different, foes to Valance.

programme.title: Snake River Desperadoes
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) squares off against men who are trying to ignite a war between whites and American Indians.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Earp and Doc Holliday prevent the men of the Bar-W ranch from lynching suspected horse thief Joe Riva; while Earp investigates the true culprit, Doc plans a scheme with Joe's daughter to take the blame off him.

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Sir Eustace Brackenstall's wife tells Holmes she saw a gang murder her savage husband.

programme.title: Life Outreach Mission Feeding
programme.desc: The hosts shed light on an initiative by a Christian organisation to fulfil the nutritional needs of malnourished children across Africa.

programme.title: Kansas Pacific
programme.desc: With the American Civil War looming, construction of the Pacific railroad is being held up in Kansas, sabotaged by Confederate sympathizers. The government dispatches an Army engineer, John Nelson (Sterling Hayden), to oversee construction, and he initially rubs the wrong way both his proud boss (Barton MacLane) and his boss's feisty daughter (Eve Miller). Eventually, though, both fall for Nelson's charms, and the hero seeks to uncover the Southern rat so he can lead the Union men due west.

programme.title: Ministry - Your Words Have Power with Joyce Meyer
programme.desc: Your words hold incredible power; today, Joyce reveals how the things you say can impact your life in profound ways.

programme.title: Word of God Ministries
programme.desc: Pastor James McMenis and his wife Chrissy are dedicated to winning the lost to Jesus and making disciples of the saved. Their goal is to bring clarity to the Word of God, making it life-applicable to people everywhere.

programme.title: The Catholic Mass
programme.desc: The Heart of the nation Sunday mass brings the beauty and traditions of the Catholic faith.

programme.title: Perry Stone
programme.desc: Religious teachings from Perry Stone.

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
programme.desc: Questions arise when Senator Stoddard (James Stewart) attends the funeral of a local man named Tom Doniphon (John Wayne) in a small Western town. Flashing back, we learn Doniphon saved Stoddard, then a lawyer, when he was roughed up by a crew of outlaws terrorizing the town, led by Liberty Valance (Lee Marvin). As the territory's safety hung in the balance, Doniphon and Stoddard, two of the only people standing up to him, proved to be very important, but different, foes to Valance.

programme.title: The Gun That Won the West
programme.desc: Superior Springfield rifles help scouts (Dennis Morgan, Richard Denning) and the cavalry get forts built in Wyoming.

programme.title: Pillow Talk
programme.desc: Playboy songwriter Brad Allen's (Rock Hudson) succession of romances annoys his neighbor, interior designer Jan Morrow (Doris Day), who shares a telephone party line with him and hears all his breezy routines. After Jan unsuccessfully lodges a complaint against him, Brad sets about to seduce her in the guise of a sincere and upstanding Texas rancher. When mutual friend Jonathan (Tony Randall) discovers that his best friend is moving in on the girl he desires, however, sparks fly.

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Too Much
programme.desc: Dr. Ben McKenna (James Stewart) is on vacation with his wife (Doris Day) and son in Morocco when a chance encounter with a stranger sets their trip, and their lives, on a drastically different course. The stranger, killed in front of the family in the marketplace, reveals an assassination plot to the Americans. The couple's son is abducted in order to ensure the plot is kept secret, and suddenly the mother and father, with no help from the police, must figure out a way to get their child back.

programme.title: Sabotage
programme.desc: A ring of saboteurs is causing havoc in London with a series of explosive terrorist attacks. Karl Verloc (Oscar Homolka) is part of the group, but he maintains a cover as a kind movie theater owner. His wife (Sylvia Sidney) is beginning to suspect something, though, and so is Scotland Yard Detective Sgt. Ted Spencer (John Loder). What neither of them know, however, is that Verloc uses his wife's little brother (Desmond Tester) to deliver the bombs in film canisters.

programme.title: The Man on the Eiffel Tower
programme.desc: When the aunt of Edna Wallace (Jean Wallace) is murdered, Inspector Jules Maigret (Charles Laughton) is brought into the case. Initial suspicion is thrown on a knife sharpener (Burgess Meredith), but Maigret soon takes notice of a student, Johann Radek (Franchot Tone), who keeps goading the police. Unfortunately, there is no evidence against Radek. The psychological games between Maigret and Radek escalate as the police narrow in on the killer, leading to a harrowing chase across Paris.

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A businessman disappears after his wife catches sight of him in an opium den.

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.title: The Buckskin Lady
programme.desc: Gambler Angela Medley (Patricia Medina) is courted by local gunman Slinger (Gerald Mohr), but she has feelings for Dr. Bruce Merritt (Richard Denning). After her father hustles Merritt out of some money, Angela promises to repay him quickly. But she loses a card game against Slinger and gets herself further into trouble. Soon, Merritt thinks she is involved with the gunman. Distraught, Angela leaves town with Slinger, but the two men continue to fight over her, with serious consequences.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick, an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible; his simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A murder investigation leads Holmes and Watson on a wild goose chase.

programme.title: Satan's Cradle
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid (Duncan Renaldo) and Pancho (Leo Carrillo) flush out a crooked lawyer and his girlfriend (Ann Savage).

programme.title: Massacre River
programme.desc: Two Army officers (Guy Madison, Rory Calhoun) love the colonel's daughter and face Indians.

programme.title: The Gun That Won the West
programme.desc: Superior Springfield rifles help scouts (Dennis Morgan, Richard Denning) and the cavalry get forts built in Wyoming.

programme.title: The Law West of Tombstone
programme.desc: A young gunslinger falls in love with the daughter of a judge who dispenses justice from a frontier saloon.

programme.title: Charade
programme.desc: After Regina Lampert (Audrey Hepburn) falls for the dashing Peter Joshua (Cary Grant) on a skiing holiday in the French Alps, she discovers upon her return to Paris that her husband has been murdered. Soon, she and Peter are giving chase to three of her late husband's World War II cronies, Tex (James Coburn), Scobie (George Kennedy) and Gideon (Ned Glass), who are after a quarter of a million dollars the quartet stole while behind enemy lines. But why does Peter keep changing his name?

programme.title: Holiday
programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

Guided by Addison, a colleague in the present day who appears to him as a hologram that only he can see and hear, he discovers the only way for him to leap again is to correct something in his host person's life. As Ben leaps from life to life, putting right what once went wrong, his team in the present tries to figure out why he leaped and bring him home.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick, an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible; his simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: Discovering the Jewish Jesus With Rabbi Kirt Schneider
programme.desc: Messianic Rabbi Kirt Schneider, a Jewish believer in Jesus, shares his insights into the Old and New Testaments, provides guidance on prayer and delivers the Word of God.

programme.title: Sanford & Son
programme.desc: Junk dealer Fred Sanford runs roughshod over his son and partner, Lamont, in a groundbreaking sitcom. Fred's moneymaking schemes routinely backfire, and he does just about anything to get out of working -- up to and including faking a heart attack. He's rude, sarcastic, outspoken, overtly prejudiced, and pretty darn nasty to his friends and family.

programme.title: Magnum, P.I.
programme.desc: This series makes the most of its Hawaiian setting by sending private eye Thomas Magnum all over Oahu righting wrongs -- at least when he isn't dealing with security at the posh estate (dubbed Robin's Nest) of absentee owner, and celebrated-but-unseen author, Robin Masters and clashing with stuffy British butler Higgins. T.C. and Rick, buddies from Magnum's days in the military, help him out with cases. Magnum is provided nearly unlimited use of many of Masters' luxury items, including a Ferrari.

programme.title: The Rockford Files

He was falsely convicted of a crime he didn't commit, but that doesn't stop him from using his ex-con buddies to help him solve crimes. Nothing comes easy for Rockford, but he works hard and usually gets shot at or beat up at least once per episode.

programme.title: Justice With Judge Mablean
programme.desc: Judge Mablean Ephriam, who presided over "Divorce Court" from 1999-2006 as the first star of the revived version of the show, returns to the courtroom genre with his half-hour series that deals with life and the law. The former Los Angeles-based prosecutor takes on the typical cases that are found on TV court shows. The arbitrator says that her show "will be life because everything we do, it involves the law."

programme.title: America's Court With Judge Ross
programme.desc: Americans just can't get enough courtroom drama, as is evidenced by yet another addition into the daytime court show fray. Former judge and prosecutor Kevin Ross adjudicates real cases, in which he tries to show litigants alternative ways of dealing with their issues and make them consider the consequences of their actions.

programme.title: America's Court With Judge Ross
programme.desc: Americans just can't get enough courtroom drama, as is evidenced by yet another addition into the daytime court show fray. programme.title: The Verdict With Judge Hatchett
programme.desc: Judge Glenda Hatchett presided over her self-titled courtroom show from 2000-2008. Now, she returns to the medium with "The Verdict." In the half-hour series, the Atlanta native and former juvenile-court judge rules over small-claims cases brought in front of her. Hatchett's courtroom isn't just about finding someone guilty, though. She also uses her experience dealing with young people and her tough-love approach to help send a message to out-of-control juvenile offenders to try to set them on the right track in their lives.

programme.title: Supreme Justice With Judge Karen
programme.desc: Karen Mills was a county court judge and criminal defense attorney in Florida before turning to TV to preside over her own court shows. In her third effort, "Supreme Justice," Mills tackles small-claims court arbitrations in her compassionate way, to which viewers of her previous shows have grown accustomed. As usual with court shows, cases involve friendships gone bad, money disputes and property damage.

programme.title: 5 Star Getaways

programme.desc: We're sailing away - and visiting exotic lands with 'Distant Shores.' Join us as we explore the waters and culture of the Middle East, the Mediterranean, and the Caribbean.

programme.title: Selling Yachts
programme.desc: Eric and Monica seek a new yacht to go with their waterfront home; Josh and Melinda are ready to purchase their first yacht.

programme.title: Road Less Traveled
programme.desc: Jonathan travels to Paris, France, where he partakes in a range of unique activities such as taking parkour lessons, exploring the Parisian catacombs, and sampling local French food.

programme.title: A Taste of Travel
programme.desc: David Reyne visits Darwin and Litchfield National Park; Scotty takes the road less traveled on an ATV tour of Phuket, before a bit of go-karting on Queenland's Sunshine Coast.

programme.desc: Student Madison looks for the ultimate West Coast vacation home for her and her parents; she's about to start college and her parents have given her the task of finding a home where they can stay while visiting.

programme.desc: The Eastern Mediterranean Sea.

programme.title: Find Me a Luxury Home
programme.desc: No strangers to the real estate business, Laurie and John are looking for a desert oasis to satiate their luxurious tastes.

programme.desc: David learns about the eco-diversity in Indonesia's wilderness; Alana explores Jinxi, a historic town in China.

programme.title: Criss Cross
programme.desc: (1949) Muscular film noir starring Burt Lancaster and Yvonne De Carlo. A dame convinces her ex-husband, an armoured car guard, to come in on a daring robbery.

programme.title: One Day Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Anne Hathaway and Jim Sturgess and director Lone Scherfig talk about making the big-screen adaptation of the best-selling novel One Day.

programme.title: Shadow of a Doubt
programme.desc: (1943) Hitchcock thriller starring Joseph Cotten as a serial killer fleeing the law. Teresa Wright is his adoring niece who, initially, refuses to believe her uncle is a murderer.

programme.title: Lifeboat
programme.desc: (1944) Alfred Hitchcock's Oscar-nominated Second World War drama starring Tallulah Bankhead, William Bendix and Walter Slezak as three of the survivors from a liner torpedoed by the Nazis.

programme.title: Fisherman's Friends
programme.desc: (2019) Heart-warming comedy based on the real-life story of the Cornish folk ensemble who took the UK charts by storm in 2010, starring Daniel Mays and Tuppence Middleton.

programme.title: The Other Woman
programme.desc: (2014) Romcom starring Cameron Diaz, Leslie Mann, Kate Upton and Nikolaj Coster-Waldau. Three women take revenge on the man who betrayed their love. Strong language, scenes that may offend.

programme.title: Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: (2011) Andrea Arnold's radical adaptation of Emily Brontë's classic novel of obsessive love, anger and revenge on the weather-beaten Yorkshire moors. With Kaya Scodelario and James Howson.

programme.title: Smoke Sauna Sisterhood
programme.desc: (2023) Anna Hints's award-winning and insightful documentary centres around a group of women taking traditional smoke saunas over a period of time, in the depths of an Estonian forest.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Animal Farm
programme.desc: (1954) George Orwell's cautionary tale reimagined in cartoon form. A farm's animals revolt against their abusive owner only for the pigs to become drunk with their newly found power.

programme.title: Written on the Wind
programme.desc: (1956) Lauren Bacall, Robert Stack, Rock Hudson and Dorothy Malone star in Douglas Sirk's drama, a commentary on 1950s life that's disguised as a lurid, glossy soap opera.

programme.title: Sink the Bismarck!
programme.desc: (1960) Second World War drama. Kenneth More stars as the British captain charged with finding and destroying the Bismarck, Germany's largest battleship. Directed by Lewis Gilbert.

programme.title: The Comancheros
programme.desc: (1961) Western starring John Wayne and Stuart Whitman. A Texas Ranger is forced to team up with his prisoner while he's on a covert mission to take on a band of thieves and gunrunners.

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: (2016) Sci-fi blockbuster sequel starring Jeff Goldblum and Liam Hemsworth. Twenty years after Earth repelled a devastating alien invasion, the extraterrestrials return to finish the job.

programme.title: Kingsman: The Golden Circle
programme.desc: (2017) Taron Egerton returns as the newest recruit to the stylish secret agency Kingsman for more ass-kicking comedy action. A star-studded cast includes Julianne Moore and Elton John.

programme.title: Babylon
programme.desc: (2022) Margot Robbie and Brad Pitt star in Damien Chazelle's opulently decadent, satirical look at Hollywood in the 1920s as it teeters between the silent the era and the 'talkies'.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Wonder Park
programme.desc: (2019) Animated adventure featuring the voices of Jennifer Garner, Mila Kunis, John Oliver and Matthew Broderick. A girl's imaginary theme park comes to life when her mum goes to hospital.

programme.title: Charade
programme.desc: (1963) Cary Grant and Audrey Hepburn star Stanley Donen's stylish Hitchcockian comedy-thriller. When her husband is murdered, a woman discovers that he was involved in a huge gold heist.

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: (1984) Comedy action adventure starring Michael Douglas and Kathleen Turner. An adventurer helps a bestselling author to search for her sister, who's been kidnapped in Colombia.

programme.title: 10 Things I Hate About You
programme.desc: (1999) Teen comedy with Julia Stiles and Heath Ledger. A student is furious to discover her prom date was bribed by her sister to invite her. But confusion ensues when he falls for her.

programme.title: One Day
programme.desc: (2011) Romantic drama. Jim Sturgess and Anne Hathaway star as friends whose lives intertwine and diverge over the years, after first meeting as graduates in 1988.

programme.title: Sleepless in Seattle
programme.desc: (1993) Romantic comedy with Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan. A bereaved man gets another chance at love when his son puts him on a radio talk show.

programme.title: Fresh
programme.desc: (2022) Adults only horror with Daisy Edgar-Jones. When date-weary Noa meets a guy in a supermarket, she thinks things are looking up. But he's oddly obsessed with not eating animals...

programme.title: A Banquet
programme.desc: (2021) Tense body-horror with Sienna Guillory. A teenage girl suddenly stops eating, but stays the same weight... Could she be a monster from Japanese folklore who has a hidden extra mouth?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes: Terror by Night
programme.desc: (1946) Sherlock Holmes murder-mystery starring Basil Rathbone and Nigel Bruce. Holmes and Dr Watson are employed to protect a priceless diamond. But it's snatched from under their noses.

programme.title: Think Like a Dog
programme.desc: (2020) Cheeky comedy with Megan Fox. A young science prodigy (Gabriel Bateman) invents a piece of tech that lets him and his pet dog communicate with each other telepathically.

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: (1990) Action comedy with Arnold Schwarzenegger. A tough cop goes undercover as a kindergarten teacher. Tough? Ha! The kids'll take him down in no time.

programme.title: The Art of Racing in the Rain
programme.desc: (2019) Touching comedy-drama. An ageing golden retriever (voiced by Kevin Costner) tells the story of his life with his best pal, a budding Formula 1 driver.

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: (2012) Sci-fi action-adventure starring Taylor Kitsch, Liam Neeson and Rihanna. When aliens land spacecraft in the Pacific Ocean, only the US and Japanese navies can save Earth. Violence.

programme.title: The Last Stand
programme.desc: (2013) Thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Johnny Knoxville and Forest Whitaker. A small-town sheriff and his inexperienced staff take on a drug cartel boss who's fleeing to Mexico.

programme.title: Bad Boys for Life
programme.desc: (2020) Action-comedy starring Will Smith and Martin Lawrence. Just when Marcus is planning to retire, a vengeful drug lord's son shoots Mike. Can our dynamic duo beat the cartel?

programme.title: Lucky Break
programme.desc: (2001) Comedy. James Nesbitt and Lennie James play inmates who see their prison governor's dreadful musical as a chance to stage a breakout. With Christopher Plummer and Olivia Williams.

programme.title: LumoTV: Getting Personal
programme.desc: Lucindha Lawson shares the story of how she made history by becoming the first deaf Asian woman to win a gold for England in the European Women's Deaf Futsal Championship.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Broken Lance
programme.desc: (1954) Western. A strict rancher (Spencer Tracy) treats his sons (Robert Wagner, Richard Widmark, Earl Holliman and Hugh O'Brian) as little more than employees, with fatal consequences.

programme.title: The Black Swan
programme.desc: (1942) Swashbuckling adventure with Laird Cregar and Tyrone Power. Privateer Captain Henry Morgan tries to rid the Caribbean of pirates when he's made Governor of Jamaica. Bit rich.

programme.title: Criss Cross
programme.desc: (1949) Muscular film noir starring Burt Lancaster as an armoured car guard who isn't drinking clearly when a dame convinces him to come in on a robbery. With Yvonne De Carlo.

programme.title: Warlock
programme.desc: (1959) Western starring Henry Fonda. A gunfighter is hired to protect a town from a raiding gang. But a vendetta could undermine him. With Anthony Quinn, Richard Widmark and Dorothy Malone.

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary...
programme.desc: ...Gentlemen: (2003) Fantasy with Sean Connery. In an alternative Victorian age, can Allan Quatermain, Dorian Gray, Captain Nemo, Mina Harker and the Invisible Man avert a war?

programme.title: M3GAN
programme.desc: (2022) Creepy-doll horror with Allison Williams. A robotics engineer simultaneously invents an AI dolly and takes on the care of her orphaned niece. But can a cyborg really raise a kid?

programme.title: Late Night with the Devil
programme.desc: (2023) Unsettling found-footage horror with David Dastmalchian. A has-been host tries to save his 70s talk show using a demonically possessed 13-year-old girl. Really, what could go wrong?

programme.title: Radical
programme.desc: (2023) Uplifting, fact-based drama with Eugenio Derbez. An inspirational teacher literally and figuratively turns his class upside down in a Mexican border town. In Spanish/subs.

programme.desc: Children are the future -- and so are their inventions, which is why "Think Big" could be an important show. It features young inventors competing to see who can come up with the most-innovative invention. The champions earn bragging rights and the coveted Genius Cup.

programme.title: America's Heartland
programme.desc: Much of the food Americans eat is produced by farmers and ranchers in the country's heartland, but many people don't know how it's produced. "America's Heartland" provides information about the people and processes responsible for the availability of food and fuel across the country and around the world. The show's reporters and producers tell stories in topics that include farm families, consumer issues, animal welfare and crop sustainability. Some episodes also take the show abroad to countries such as Egypt and Taiwan to show the impact American agriculture has on the global economy.

programme.title: Cattle Queen of Montana
programme.desc: When defiant female rancher Sierra Nevada Jones (Barbara Stanwyck) sweeps into Montana, she receives a hostile welcome from a tribe of Native Americans who attack her cattle and leave her father dead. Kindly Indian brave Colorados (Lance Fuller) and government officer Farrell (Ronald Reagan) help Sierra fight for her land against treacherous locals like the envious Tom McCord (Gene Evans), a neighboring rancher determined to cheat Jones out of her property and drive her back to Texas.

programme.title: Squawk Box
programme.desc: The big names in business and politics tell their important stories in this pre-market morning news and talk program; from professional traders to casual investors.

programme.title: Squawk on the Street
programme.desc: Taking viewers onto the floor of the exchange, right to the posts where the big companies in the world trade; tick charts track the action of every trade of every stock; the treasury, currency and commodity action in real time.

programme.title: Money Movers
programme.desc: Anchors Carl Quintanilla and Sara Eisen focus on what is moving the stock markets, the agenda for the business day, detailed data on individual stocks, sectors and the indices that investors and traders want.

programme.title: Halftime Report
programme.desc: The front lines of market coverage; host Scott Wapner and the top investors get to the heart of the action as it's happening and help set the agenda for the rest of the day.

programme.title: The Exchange
programme.desc: Anchor Kelly Evans reports on the important stories to markets and investors; reporters provide actionable information to viewers as they make daily investment decisions.

programme.title: Power Lunch
programme.desc: Focusing on real-time market coverage, breaking news and up-to-the-instant stock moving information; delving into the economy, the markets, real estate, media and technology -- any place where there's money to be made.

programme.title: Closing Bell
programme.desc: A guide through the most important hour of the Wall Street trading day, and taking a close-up look at how the markets are moving, what's driving them and how investors are reacting; coverage includes reports from the CME Group, NASDAQ and the NYSE.

programme.title: Closing Bell: Overtime
programme.desc: A look at after-hours moves, including breaking news, corporate earnings and post-market trading; big investors, smart strategists and top money managers debate actionable ideas and the big market themes of the day.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E10 San Francisco Ben, Hoss and Joe decide to visit San Francisco with some of their ranch hands. The hands vanish into the crowds and while searching for them, Ben finds himself shanghaied and on a ship destined for Hong Kong.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E23 The Second Witness Lucas' life is in danger after he agrees to testify in a murder case in another town. The only other witness was killed, and when a gun-toting stranger appears at the McCain Ranch, Lucas now finds himself in grave danger.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E24 The Trade Outlaw Sam Morley, an old friend, comes to the McCain Ranch. He asks Lucas to turn in him for the $500 reward and use the money to pay for his girlfriend's medical care. However, a bounty hunter has other ideas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E25 One Went to Denver Tom Birch, an old childhood friend, comes to visit Lucas unexpectedly. Birch promises he is just passing through on his way to Denver. But Lucas soon finds out about a plot to rob the North Fork Bank and must choose between friendship and justice.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E26 The Deadly Wait Just released from prison, Dan Maury comes to North Fork in search of Marshal Micah Torrance, who helped get him locked up. Torrance carries a shotgun everywhere he goes, but Maury plans to wait him out.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E9 Specialty Sales and Recipe Fails As the cowboys continue to expand their operation, they round up some of their cattle in north Alabama and ship them down to greener pastures in south Florida. Cody and Misty are looking for extra income but they are unsure if they have enough time in their busy schedule to stage another specialty cattle sale. Bubba's hard work pays off when he finds a buyer for the ranch horses he's been training. Booger and Jaclyn struggle to recreate Grandma's recipes for a cowboy cookbook, so they call the families together for a taste test and some honest feedback.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E10 Generations to Come Booger and Bubba struggle to keep up with ranch work while Cody is busy with his specialty cattle sale. Much to Bubba's chagrin, Booger hires their ornery old hand Billy to pick up the slack. Cody manages to pack the sale barn with potential buyers, but will they open their wallets for the high-end cattle? Bubba and Kaley turn their dining room into a playroom for their expanding family. Booger begins collecting old stories and memories from Grandma to accompany the recipes in her cowboy cookbook.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E14 Surveyors Mark overhears men plotting to rob the North Fork Bank while at a surveying camp and tells Lucas about what he heard. When Lucas questions his story, Mark runs away from home. Lucas later learns Mark was telling the truth and helps capture the men.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E15 Day of the Hunter A famous old frontiersman, with a reputation as the best rifleman around, challenges Luke to see who's really the best with a rifle.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S1 E4 Corporal Agarn's Farewell to the Troops Parmenter goes after the Colton brothers and a $5000 reward. Meanwhile, Agarn overhears the doctor and O'Rourke discussing a dire health report. Suffering from stomach pains himself, he fears death is knocking on his door.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S1 E5 The Return of Bald Eagle Bald Eagle, a crazy, unpredictable renegade, plans to attack Fort Courage alone. Captain Parmenter readies the fort for battle. However, Bald Eagle's plans fail and he is captured. He soon escapes and takes Parmenter hostage.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E6 Sister Blandina and the Killer When a bloodthirsty mob storms a jailhouse holding a man accused of attempted murder, they are confronted by a 22-year-old missionary from the Sisters of Charity. Only Sister Blandina can stop the vigilantes from taking the law into their own hands.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E1 Bat Masterson to the Rescue Now without a badge, former lawman Bat Masterson finds himself powerless to help an old friend whose brother has been falsely imprisoned. An overreaching sheriff is intent on seeing the brother hang, so Bat hatches a plan to bust him out of jail.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S2 E6 Tom Fitzpatrick: Steadfast Frontiersman By the 1840s, the fur trade is ending, forcing lifelong frontiersmen like Tom Fitzpatrick to adapt. When he becomes a guide for some of the first Americans to emigrate to California, he faces new dangers even as his way of life is becoming obsolete.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E11 Good Night Sweet Charlotte Charlotte, an old friend of Lou's, comes to Rock Creek and stirs up bad memories of a man who had hurt them both. Lou distances herself from Kid, but when Charlotte turns up dead, Lou confronts her past. Meanwhile, Jimmy befriends a Lakota Indian.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S4 E8 Apache Blood Cheyenne returns a young white man named Mickey, who was kidnapped by the Apaches when he was a child. Problems arise when Mickey's family isn't accepting of his Mexican wife. Mickey rebels against his family, and Cheyenne tries to save his marriage.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S4 E9 Outcast of Cripple Creek After his friend passes away, Cheyenne becomes the marshal of Cripple Creek. Disgusted by all the corruption in the small town, he resigns. His successor arrives but may need Cheyenne's help to keep the peace.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E11 Bitter Water When miner Lem Keith plans to buy land next to the Ponderosa, he goes to the owner's son, Todd, who is willing to help Lem because he is in love with Lem's daughter. Plus, they both share a common hatred of the Cartwrights.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E27 The Wrong Man A crooked marshal comes to North Fork looking for a wanted man. He finds a man fitting the futitive's description. He deliberately kills the wrong man to collect the bounty and then blackmails the real outlaw, who wants to keep his past hidden.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E28 The Challenge An escaped killer wants to prove he hasn't lost his nerve when he holds up North Fork's General Store and takes Marshal Micah Torrance hostage. He provokes the town to try to face him, but only Lucas is strong enough to rise up to his challenge.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E29 The Hawk Mark finally captures a hawk that he has been chasing but he encounters a rattlesnake in the process. When a stranger quickly comes to his rescue, a grateful Mark invites the man to the ranch, unaware he is a fugitive on the run from the law.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E30 Three-Legged Terror A troubled 18-year-old named Johnny Clover ransacks the North Fork Schoolhouse, stealing art supplies. Lucas later tries to help Johnny, but he lives with a controlling uncle who proves to be difficult to deal with.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E9 Specialty Sales and Recipe Fails As the cowboys continue to expand their operation, they round up some of their cattle in north Alabama and ship them down to greener pastures in south Florida. Cody and Misty are looking for extra income but they are unsure if they have enough time in their busy schedule to stage another specialty cattle sale. Bubba's hard work pays off when he finds a buyer for the ranch horses he's been training. Booger and Jaclyn struggle to recreate Grandma's recipes for a cowboy cookbook, so they call the families together for a taste test and some honest feedback.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E10 Generations to Come Booger and Bubba struggle to keep up with ranch work while Cody is busy with his specialty cattle sale. programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E29 The Hawk Mark finally captures a hawk that he has been chasing but he encounters a rattlesnake in the process. When a stranger quickly comes to his rescue, a grateful Mark invites the man to the ranch, unaware he is a fugitive on the run from the law.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E30 Three-Legged Terror A troubled 18-year-old named Johnny Clover ransacks the North Fork Schoolhouse, stealing art supplies. Lucas later tries to help Johnny, but he lives with a controlling uncle who proves to be difficult to deal with.

programme.title: Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: A homesteading family in 1867 Wyoming faces a crisis when the husband is killed and the wife must decide whether to remain or take her son and daughter back East.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Spirit of Truth After his fur trapping expedition is surprised by a Crow war party, legendary mountain man Jim Bridger suddenly finds himself in a desperate struggle to rescue his fellow trappers when one of them goes missing, and another is on the brink of madness.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E16 Mail Order Groom A mail-order husband arrives in North Fork, and finds not only a bride, but also harassment from two local troublemakers.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E17 A Case of Identity Aaron Wingate lost his wife and son in a river boat fire years ago. The boy was never found. Wingate hires two private detectives who come to North Fork and decide that Mark will fit the bill. Lucas must fight for custody.

programme.title: Legends of the Stagecoach
programme.desc: A marvel of engineering, the iconic stagecoach becomes indispensable when Americans settle the West. As stagecoaches and their heroic drivers navigate perilous trails to transport passengers and valuables, they are easy targets for lawless bandits.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E11 Al Jennings and the Legend of Dick West Tired of his boring life, attorney Al Jennings dreams of the adventures he reads in dime novels. After a chance encounter with Dick West, Jennings joins the outlaw's gang and learns that a life of crime isn't as glamorous as he thought it would be.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E9 The Trials of Temple Houston Temple Houston, flamboyant son of Sam Houston, works hard to live up to his famous name as a top attorney in the Oklahoma Territory. But his flair for showmanship annoys his courtroom rivals, the Jennings brothers, and the feud erupts into bloodshed.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E6 Christopher Gist: Unsung Hero of the First Frontier After mapping the rugged Ohio Country, frontiersman and surveyor Christopher Gist accepts a new mission: lead a young George Washington to a remote French fort in the Ohio wilderness on a diplomatic journey which may change the course of history.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E12 Song of Isiah Isiah Burke and his wife Rosemary are abolitionists who are trying to lead a group to freedom. Jimmy, who is visiting his sister, becomes involved with them but soon finds out that their tactics are too violent.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E2 The Mission Captain Pender is looking for a scout and Hoss suggests former scout Charlie Trent. Charlie is less than dependable because he feels responsible for a massacre in the past. Now, he spends most of his time with a bottle.

programme.title: My Name Is Nobody
programme.desc: A young and easy-going drifter befriends a legendary gunslinger who wants to retire. The drifter considers the shooter his hero and insists that he must face a gang of 150 outlaws before he can lay down his guns.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E13 The Silent Knife Mark, a young mute boy, arrives in North Fork. When townspeople treat Mark badly because he cannot speak, Lucas and his son, Mark, befriend him. Desperate for cash, the boy steals $500 from a stagecoach line. Lucas convinces him to return the money.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E2 Put a Ring on It When an infection threatens the herd, Bubba, Cody and Booger have to act fast. They enlist the help of young veterinary student Dakota to doctor the cows and keep the virus from spreading. Cody helps Misty take the first step towards starting her cattle business. The cowboys decide to build an office for the company, but Bubba throws a wrench into the plan when he's called to Mississippi to visit Kaley's parents. Bubba's in-laws pressure him to take a hard look at his future while Booger works up the nerve to pop the question and start a future with Jaclyn.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E29 Shotgun Man Lucas receives several mysterious threatening notes. He discovers they are being sent from ex-convict, John Beaumont, who is bent on revenge. Beaumont wants Lucas dead since he is the one responsible for his imprisonment.

programme.title: Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: A homesteading family in 1867 Wyoming faces a crisis when the husband is killed and the wife must decide whether to remain or take her son and daughter back East.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger

programme.desc: S3 E13 The Silent Knife Mark, a young mute boy, arrives in North Fork. When townspeople treat Mark badly because he cannot speak, Lucas and his son, Mark, befriend him. Desperate for cash, the boy steals $500 from a stagecoach line. Lucas convinces him to return the money.

programme.desc: S2 E2 Put a Ring on It When an infection threatens the herd, Bubba, Cody and Booger have to act fast. The cowboys decide to build an office for the company, but Bubba throws a wrench into the plan when he's called to Mississippi to visit Kaley's parents. Bubba's in-laws pressure him to take a hard look at his future while Booger works up the nerve to pop the question and start a future with Jaclyn.

programme.title: Romance in the Wilds
programme.desc: Deep in the Rocky Mountains, lightning strikes a mining site, sparking a deadly wildfire and igniting an unexpected romance between a forest ranger and a geologist as they race to escape the flames.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E7 Escape to Ponderosa Three deserters escape from an Army stockade and hide at the Ponderosa. When a captain comes looking for them, Ben soon realizes how the prisoners are being treated and resolves to confront his good friend in charge.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Avenger Hoss and Joe desperately look for a way to prevent brothers Adam and Ben from being hanged for a crime. A stranger, Lassiter, comes to town in an attempt to find the truth and prove Adam and Ben's innocence.

programme.title: Freedom on the Range
programme.desc: S1 E1 From brave lawmen to rugged cowboys, discover the untold stories of African Americans' cultural significance in the Old West.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E4 The Legend of Nat Love When Black cowboy Nat Love overnights in Deadwood during a cattle drive, he decides to enter a Fourth of July cowboy competition. Confident in his roping, riding, and shooting skills, he is eager to test his mettle against the best cowboys around.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E3 Bass Reeves Tracks Belle Starr As U.S. Marshal Bass Reeves attempts to arrest Belle Starr and her outlaw husband, Belle asks for 24 hours to find someone to care for her young daughter, Pearl. When the Starr family decides to flee instead, the Marshal must track them down.

programme.title: Elkhorn
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Stranglers After some of Theodore Roosevelt's new horses are stolen, he joins a posse of vigilantes to hunt down the thieves. When they capture a lone outcast who swears his innocence, Roosevelt learns firsthand that frontier justice isn't always just.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E21 The Indian U.S. Marshal Sam Buckhart escorts an Indian prisoner back east to stand trial. They arrive in North Fork and Lucas finds out that Buckhart is also an Indian who was educated at Harvard. Angry townspeople try to take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E22 The Boarding House Julia Andueza opens a boarding house in North Fork. Lucas remembers her as a dishonest card dealer from the past. Her old boss arrives and tries to bully Julia into turning her business into a gambling house. Lucas realizes she has changed her ways.

programme.title: Love in Wolf Creek
programme.desc: On the eve of a big-city donor's visit, Samantha Groves, director of the wildlife center, teams up with local rancher Austin Spencer and risks the future of her fledging rescue center to find and save a white wolf with life-threatening injuries.

programme.title: War of the Wildcats
programme.desc: During the early days of the Oklahoma oil boom, a greedy, self-assured oilman and a quiet, yet determined cowboy fight for the rights to oil on Indian land. All the while a pretty schoolteacher steals both men's hearts.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E32 The Lonesome Bride Brothers Charv and Kelly Banner play a joke on Lucas that soon gets out of hand when they contact a St. Louis marriage bureau to send a possible bride for Lucas. Mary Woodson arrives in North Fork ready for marriage, but Lucas wants no part of it.

programme.title: Romance in the Wilds
programme.desc: Deep in the Rocky Mountains, lightning strikes a mining site, sparking a deadly wildfire and igniting an unexpected romance between a forest ranger and a geologist as they race to escape the flames.

programme.title: War of the Wildcats
programme.desc: During the early days of the Oklahoma oil boom, a greedy, self-assured oilman and a quiet, yet determined cowboy fight for the rights to oil on Indian land. All the while a pretty schoolteacher steals both men's hearts.

programme.title: Rage at Dawn
programme.desc: In 1866, the Reno Brothers gang is ravaging Indiana. When a detective agency sends a man to infiltrate the gang by posing as an outlaw, he sets a trap to capture the gang during an early-morning train robbery.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E10 Miss Parmenter Captain Wilton Parmenter's equally clumsy sister, Daphne, visits Fort Courage. She is on a mission to find a husband and soon sets her sights on Dobbs the bugler. In the process, she creates havoc for the F Troop while attempting to marry Dobbs.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E11 La Dolce Courage An Italian man, Emilio Barberini, and his beautiful daughter, Gina, visit the F Troop at Fort Courage. Her beauty attracts the attention of every man, but her hot-headed suitor is pursuing her and swears vengeance on anyone who even glances her way.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E19 Man Behind the Badge Van Dorn, a corrupt businessman and the man responsible for the murder of Marshal Sam Cain's wife, comes to Sweetwater. First, he ousts Cain and takes over the town, and then he appoints his gang to be the law enforcement for the town.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E20 Then There Was One Teaspoon travels to Texas with an old comrade to warn three aging veterans that someone has been murdering the last men who genuinely remember the Alamo. Jimmy and Buck follow from behind as Teaspoon tracks down the killer.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E3 The Blowout Al Walker, a sick gunslinger, comes to North Fork hoping to die in peace. Knowing that his presence will attract outlaws, Micah and Lucas put him in protective custody. When outlaws set fire to the town, Walker dies a hero by standing up to them.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E4 Obituary Newspaperman Byron Claremont writes an article about old gunslinger, Ben Russell, who settled down years ago. The article brings in a young gun, who murders Russell. Next, Claremont writes about Lucas McCain and his rifle, which brings more tragedy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E5 Tension Lucas and Mark help Sid Halpern with his cattle drive. When bounty hunter Clemmie Martin confronts Halpern and gunfire erupts, Halpern and Martin both perish. Lucas tries to hide Halpern's criminal past from his widow and son.

programme.title: Gunslinger
programme.desc: When a town marshal is gunned down, his wife bravely returns fire at the gunmen and kills one. The widow is named the town's temporary marshal. At her husband's funeral, she spies the second killer and plans to finish avenging her husband.

programme.title: Red Sun
programme.desc: In 1870, a gang robs a train carrying Japanese diplomats. The gang takes an ornate Japanese sword meant as a gift for the U.S. president. Now, a gunman and samurai must lay their differences aside and work together to recover the priceless gift.

programme.title: The Proud Rebel
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran battles prejudice and greed as he helps a woman save her ranch from a land grab, while searching for a cure for his mute son.

programme.title: Rage at Dawn
programme.desc: In 1866, the Reno Brothers gang is ravaging Indiana. When a detective agency sends a man to infiltrate the gang by posing as an outlaw, he sets a trap to capture the gang during an early-morning train robbery.

programme.desc: When a town marshal is gunned down, his wife bravely returns fire at the gunmen and kills one. The widow is named the town's temporary marshal. At her husband's funeral, she spies the second killer and plans to finish avenging her husband.

programme.title: Red Sun
programme.desc: In 1870, a gang robs a train carrying Japanese diplomats. The gang takes an ornate Japanese sword meant as a gift for the U.S. president. Now, a gunman and samurai must lay their differences aside and work together to recover the priceless gift.

programme.title: The Proud Rebel
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran battles prejudice and greed as he helps a woman save her ranch from a land grab, while searching for a cure for his mute son.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E11 Let It Ripp The cowboys are busy processing cattle and preparing for an important shipment when a chute gets stuck, bringing work to a halt and risking time and money they can't afford to lose. Booger trains a cutting horse and enters it into its first competition. Cody organizes a campout for the youth at the Alabama Sheriff's Boys Ranch, and the guys share some of their cowboy wisdom with the hope of inspiring another generation to follow the cowboy way. Friends and family gather for a baby shower, where Bubba and Kaley reveal the name they've chosen for their new addition.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E12 Final Cow Down, The During a long drought in lower Alabama, the cowboys have been chasing green grass throughout the surrounding area. Through new partnerships with other ranchers, they've finally ended up with a bumper crop of calves in north Alabama and a healthy herd in south Florida. Cody and Misty seek out the perfect high-value bull to build their growing cattle business, and they watch as their dream home finally takes shape. Bubba and Kaley welcome baby Ripp Walker Thompson into the world. Booger and Jaclyn surprise Grandma with a cowboy cookbook filled with her recipes and stories from life on the range.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E18 The Visitor A pretty young widow named Ann Dodd passes through North Fork on her way to claim her inheritance. She and Lucas are immediately attracted to each other, but danger awaits as other heirs try to take Ann's life to get the inheritance for themselves.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E19 Hero While hunting, Colly Vane encounters a dangerous outlaw, The Domino Kid, who forces Vane to shoot him. When he brings the body back to town, it's discovered he was shot in the back. Instead of being a hero, Vane faces danger.

programme.title: Elkhorn
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Greenhorn After suffering a great personal loss, 25-year-old Theodore Roosevelt abandons New York for the lawless Dakota Badlands. Along the way, he faces doubters and killers as he attempts to establish the Elkhorn Ranch and remake himself into a cattleman.

programme.title: Elkhorn
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Frenchman Before it's up and running, Theodore Roosevelt's new Elkhorn Ranch is threatened by a powerful neighbor who attempts an underhanded land grab. To save his ranch, Roosevelt confronts his neighbor, the Marquis de Morés, and his beguiling wife, Medora.

programme.title: Cavalry Charge
programme.desc: When two brothers each decide to fight on opposite sides in the Civil War, they never dreamed they would need to reunite and fight together. It is the only chance they have, if they hope to survive a brutal Indian attack.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S4 E10 Alibi for the Scalped Man Cheyenne travels to Emmetville for his friend's wedding. When he arrives in town, he finds out that his friend is missing. Suspicious arise around the tight-lipped Emmet family and the bride-to-be who doesn't seemed concerned of his whereabouts.

programme.title: Elkhorn
programme.desc: S1 E7 Bandits When a masked bandit terrorizes the stagecoach line, killing a passenger, Theodore Roosevelt and his Elkhorn men join the citizens of Medora to track down the culprit. Can they lay a trap to catch the killer before he strikes again?

programme.title: Elkhorn
programme.desc: S1 E8 Crossroads After a wildfire rages through Elkhorn Ranch, Theodore Roosevelt is forced to sell some livestock before the fall roundup. But Roosevelt's pride prevents him from accepting a low offer from the town's founder, triggering a violent chain of events.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E31 The Angry Man A neighboring rancher's son is seriously injured in an accident. With the young man's condition getting worse, Lucas learns the rancher won't take his son to the doctor since he feels his wife died from poor treatment.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E32 The Woman The residents force Miss Adams, the North Fork schoolteacher, to leave her job because they feel she is too progressive for supporting women's right to vote. Lucas gets involved and he learns that lies have been circulated by a past student.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E33 The Money Gun Lucas has a disdain for Oat Jackford since years ago he burned down his ranch to get him off property he wanted. When hired killer Tom King arrives in North Fork and is on Oat's trail, Lucas decides to side with and help the man he once hated.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E34 A Matter of Faith A trail bum rides into North Fork during one of the worst droughts in years. He claims that he can bring rain to their town. Many believe that he's a water witcher, but a railroad boss resents his intrusion and wants him gone.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E11 Let It Ripp The cowboys are busy processing cattle and preparing for an important shipment when a chute gets stuck, bringing work to a halt and risking time and money they can't afford to lose. Cody organizes a campout for the youth at the Alabama Sheriff's Boys Ranch, and the guys share some of their cowboy wisdom with the hope of inspiring another generation to follow the cowboy way. Friends and family gather for a baby shower, where Bubba and Kaley reveal the name they've chosen for their new addition.

programme.desc: Specializing in muscle, classic and late model exotics, Vicari Auctions have grown to offer over 600 vehicles up for bid with no reserve while generating over $8 million in sales at each event.

programme.title: 2026 King of the Hammers
programme.desc: Only the strongest competitors and machines compete in this one-of-a-kind off-road race that requires both speed and survival to finish this true test of man and machine.

programme.title: Lost Classics
programme.desc: Tony digs out a rare Mustang that's been hidden under dusty boxes for decades, but the owner has another surprise in store. Then Tony gets a chance to size up a Model A truck at an auction preview before he heads to the famous Spring Carlisle..

programme.title: My Classic Car
programme.desc: Host Dennis Gage upholds his "honor the timeless classics" catchphrase in this series, as he travels across North America to visit prestigious auto shows and events, spotlighting everything from muscle cars to museum pieces. The handlebar mustachioed Gage takes viewers along for the ride and keeps it entertaining with his unique perspective and enthusiasm for all things automotive.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey takes an old, beat-up '66 Mustang and puts some pep back; he shows how to replace an old automatic transmission with a quick-shifting Tremec T5 5-speed; he also shows how to lift an old cab or body off a frame without destroying it.

programme.title: Sam's Garage
programme.desc: Sam installs a Holley Sniper EFI & MSD on Vic's '66 Mustang.

programme.title: Lost Classics
programme.desc: When a client puts out the call for a DeLorean, Tony finds two dramatically different contenders: one showroom-clean, the other frozen in time. It's nostalgia versus perfection as Tony helps figure out what's the best route for his client to take.

programme.title: Lost Classics
programme.desc: Tony helps an owner move a custom Mercury to none other than Joe Zolper as a potential buyer. Then, a lead sends Tony to a dusty garage hiding a nearly untouched Porsche RS America with just 5,000 original miles.

programme.title: 2026 King of the Hammers
programme.desc: Only the strongest competitors and machines compete in this one-of-a-kind off-road race that requires both speed and survival to finish this true test of man and machine.

programme.title: Dempsey and Makepeace
programme.desc: The Squeeze: Classic detective series. A security van loaded with half a million pounds is hijacked and mysteriously disappears after one of its guards is murdered. S1 Ep2

programme.title: Magnum, P.I.
programme.desc: Blind Justice: Classic US action drama series. The Hawaii assistant DA hires Thomas to gather evidence against a man accused of killing his wife, but the case presents a dilemma. S5 Ep3

programme.title: Kojak
programme.desc: Be Careful What You Pray For: Classic US detective drama. When two brothers kill a priest at a Catholic school after a failed hijacking, the case proves embarrassing for the police. S3 Ep5

programme.title: Boon
programme.desc: One Reborn Every Minute: Classic drama. Boon is hired by an evangelical preacher to find out who is sabotaging his shows and ruining his chances of winning a television contract. S3 Ep11

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: Hit and Run: George Carter's wife Alison is mistaken for a fellow teacher with dubious connections and is killed by a hired assassin. S2 Ep5

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: You Need Hands: Drama series about the exploits of a loveable rogue. When Arthur takes on some hired help after Terry gets injured, he unwittingly gets mixed up in drug dealing. S3 Ep2

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: Great Racehorses
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin introduces some of the great racehorses of the modern era from Nijinsky to Tiger Roll, plus Best Mate's third Gold Cup and Shergar racing to Derby glory.

programme.desc: Surreal romantic horror comedy film starring Simon Pegg, 2004. When the undead take over London, a loser leaps into action to get to the safest place he knows of - the pub.
